P7.DESC1_1: Mira el anillo de color y selecciona el color que m√°s te guste. Quedan 7 colores. P7.DESC2_1: Colors surrounded mankind since the beginning of time, influenced humans for generations. In the beginning, human life was ruled by two uncontrollable factors: night and day. Light and darkness. For thousands of years man's actions, such as attack (red) or retreat (green) were embedded into submind. The colors of nature have had their influence on us, and these influences are deep-rooted in our subminds. Colors and their subconscious meaning are there, whether we like it or not. That meaning is independent of race, language, education level, social status, etc.
P7.DESC2_2: Because of this, a color test is an optimal tool to analyze family conflicts, personal life issues, casual mood changes, and even for conducting forensic psychological examinations.
P7.DESC3_1: Some organizations use color tests to control the dynamics of the volitional and emotional spheres of athletes both during training and during competition. This enables the trainer to anticipate in advance and purposefully eliminate breakdowns due to the depletion of the energy or volitional capabilities of the athletes.
P7.DESC3_2: Several sources suggest some color tests work even in cases of defective color-vision or even actual color blindness since the acceptability of a particu¬≠lar color is somatically.
